0.last_action: Committee transferred to House State Government & Elections
0.title: General State Officers
0.description: Enables the general assembly, while in grand committee, to fill a vacancy in the office of the lieutenant governor.

1.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1.title: Disorderly Conduct -- Unlawful Interference With Traffic
1.description: Criminalizes and sets mandatory minimum felony sentences for the unlawful interference with traffic upon the federal and state highways of this state.

2.title: Nursing Home Staffing And Quality Care Act
2.description: Mandates minimum staffing levels, standards for quality care for nursing homes and their residents, and provides wage increases subject to the rate of inflation.

3.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
3.title: Personal Income Tax
3.description: Raises the earned income tax credit from fifteen percent (15%) to twenty percent (20%) for tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2021.

4.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
4.title: Bus Lane Travel Fine
4.description: Creates a new traffic offense, with a fine, for traveling in a bus lane.

5.title: Property Subject To Taxation -- Exemptions
5.description: Includes the real and tangible personal property of The Providence Community Health Centers, a Rhode Island domestic nonprofit corporation, located in Providence, Rhode Island, on the list of properties exempt from taxation.

6.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
6.title: The Edward O. Hawkins And Thomas C. Slater Medical Marijuana Act
6.description: Adds a definition to the term "manufacture" in the medical marijuana chapter.

7.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
7.title: Curriculum
7.description: Directs the council on elementary and secondary education to develop recommendations for a high school curriculum to prepare students for successful postsecondary education and careers in computer science.

8.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
8.title: Expungement Of Criminal Records
8.description: Allows persons with multiple misdemeanors and felonies to seek expungement of up to six convictions provided that convictions for multiple alcohol related offenses or domestic violence offenses and crime of violence are not eligible.

10.title: Authorizing The Exeter -- West Greenwich Regional School District To Issue Not To Exceed $17,840,000 General Obligation Bonds And Notes To Finance The Renovation, Rehabilitation, Improvement, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The District, Including, But Not Limited To, Auditorium And Classroom Improvements, Information Technology, Roofs, Floors, Heating, Ventilation, Air Conditioning, Electrical Systems, Playgrounds, Athletic Facilities, Parking And Safety Improvements, Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By The Amount Of Certain Grants Received From State Bond Proceeds, From The Rhode Island Department Of Education Or From The Rhode Island School Building Authority
10.description: Authorizes the Exeter-West Greenwich Regional School District to issue general obligation bonds not to exceed $17,840,000 for school improvements.

11.title: North Smithfield -- Historic Residence Tax Credit
11.description: Allows North Smithfield historic residence owners to become eligible for state historic residence tax credits.

12.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
12.title: Retirement System -- Membership And Service Credits
12.description: Allows teachers, who are at the top step maximum salary, to retire early.

13.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
13.title: Education Accountability Act
13.description: Incorporates SurveyWorks school climate indicators for evaluating the performance of LEAs and individual public schools.

14.title: The Civic Literacy Act
14.description: Requires the implementation of the civic literacy act for all students between the 8th and 12th grades.

15.title: Minimum Wages
15.description: Provides that employers pay essential health care facility employees at a rate of one hundred fifty percent (150%) of their regular pay during a declared public health emergency.

16.title: Related To Motor And Other Vehicles -- Electric Vehicle Charging Stations
16.description: Requires the department of transportation, along with the division of motor vehicles and the office of energy resources, to develop, no later than January 1, 2022, a plan for statewide electric vehicle charging station infrastructure.

17.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
17.title: Open Meetings
17.description: Requires that all meetings closed to the public be audio recorded by audio tape or other audio recording device.

18.title: Solemnization Of Marriages
18.description: Allows the governor to designate any person to solemnize a marriage within the state of Rhode Island on a particular day and within a particular city or town.

19.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
19.title: Housing For The Elderly--emergency Generators Required
19.description: Requires elderly housing complexes of more than 100 residential units provide emergency generators to power all common areas and residential units in building effective 1/1/22.

20.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
20.title: Born-alive Infant Protection Act
20.description: Enacts the Born-Alive Infant Protection Act and provide for the duties and obligations of medical personnel in certain circumstances.

21.title: Procedure Generally - Levy And Sale On Execution
21.description: Exempts from attachment five hundred dollars ($500) in savings or deposits in financial or banking institutions.

22.title: Explosives, Fireworks, And Pyrotechnics
22.description: Prohibits the use of display fireworks/aerial consumer fireworks without a permit between 12:00 a.m. and 7:00 a.m. on any day and would make a violation of this permit requirement a civil violation punishable by a fine of $75.00 and court costs.

23.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
23.title: Animal Abuser Registry Act
23.description: Creates the "animal abuser registry act" which would require all persons convicted of felonies involving animal abuse, to register with an online registry to be established and maintained by the department of public safety.

24.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
24.title: Relating To Food And Drugs
24.description: Requires drug manufactures to establish fund and manage state approved drug take back programs, free of charge to the consumer and pharmacy.

25.title: Relating To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Lodie Brien Agency, Inc.
25.description: Relating To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Lodie Brien Agency, Inc.

26.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Sherwood Condominium, Inc.
26.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Sherwood Condominium, Inc.

27.title: Rhode Island Business Corporation Act
27.description: Increases time that SOS can withdraw a certificate of revocation for a corporation, nonprofit corporation, or LLC from 10 to 20 years without the corporation or limited liability company being required to seek reinstatement by the legislature.

28.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
28.title: Covid-19 Insurance Relief Act
28.description: Requires an insurer to provide business interruption coverage due to the global pandemic COVID-19.

29.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
29.title: Rhode Island Turnpike And Bridge Authority
29.description: Provides that DOT, in conjunction with the RI turnpike and bridge authority, erect a safety barrier or safety netting on the Mount Hope Bridge, the Claiborne Pell Bridge, Verrazzano Bridge. Safety barrier or netting to be erected on or before 1/1/2023.

30.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
30.title: Internet Service Providers -- Net Neutrality
30.description: Requires Internet service providers to follow Internet service neutrality requirements.

31.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
31.title: Department Of Transportation
31.description: Allows DOT to make emergency repairs to municipal roads upon request up to $150,000 unless higher amount agreed to in writing with payment determination within 90 days.

32.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
32.title: Public Utilities Commission
32.description: Requires an electric utility company to bury power lines in the event of a residential power outage lasting ninety-six (96) consecutive hours or more, unless the outage was caused by the resident.

33.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
33.title: Military Spouse Licensure
33.description: Provides issuance of occupational licenses for military members and spouses stationed in Rhode Island.

34.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
34.title: Relating To Fish And Wildlife
34.description: Prohibits the practice of importing a wild animal into the state, which animal is not native or domestic to the state, for the purpose of conducting canned hunting.

35.title: Bristol County Water Supply
35.description: Delete a portion of the enabling statute for the Bristol County Water Authority.

37.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
37.title: The Rhode Island Early Childhood Innovation Act
37.description: Establishes the RI Early Childhood Innovation Act and authorizes department of human services to fund programs for at-risk kindergarten children of $1,000,000 annually.

38.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
38.title: Relating To State Affairs And Government
38.description: Creates a pilot program to provide scholarships to certified nursing assistants employed in certain high needs fields.

39.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
39.title: Sales And Use Taxes -- Liability And Computation
39.description: Exempts self-employed sole practicing investigators operating independently from any partnership, corporation, limited liability company or association from the sales tax imposed on services.

40.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
40.title: Barbers, Hairdressers, Cosmeticians, Manicurists And Estheticians
40.description: Repeals requirement a person licensed as barber be a citizen of United States and be of good moral character. Also repeals requirement that a person so licensed pay a license fee for the business.

41.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
41.title: Governor's Council On Behavioral Health
41.description: Increases the membership of the governor's council on behavioral health from thirty-one (31) to thirty-two (32) members by adding the president of the Hospital Association of Rhode Island or a designee.

42.title: The Promoting Access To Increased Mental Health Services For All Students Act
42.description: Directs that services provided by school social workers and certified school psychologists would be included as health care related services eligible for federal Medicaid reimbursement.

43.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
43.title: Relating To Education
43.description: Promotes healthy school buildings and grounds by prohibiting the use of certain appliances in school buildings.

44.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
44.title: Equitable Access For All Students Act
44.description: Requires all charter public schools actively recruit students from and in every district that the school is chartered to service and receive students from.

45.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
45.title: Compulsory Attendance
45.description: Directs school districts experiencing high rates of student absenteeism to establish attendance review teams to address this absenteeism.

46.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
46.title: Accessible Residence Modifications
46.description: Allows health insurance plans to provide coverage for accessible residence modifications determined to be medically necessary.

47.title: Securing The Financial Future For All Students Act
47.description: Provides that the council on elementary and secondary education be encouraged to maintain, publish and update statewide standards for instruction of personal finance in public high schools.

48.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
48.title: Assisted Living Residences
48.description: Requires department of health to establish an informal dispute resolution to address any changes to department of health violations.

49.title: Dentists And Dental Hygienists
49.description: Requires at least one oral and maxillofacial surgeon on the Rhode Island board of examiners in dentistry.

51.last_action: Referred to Senate Health and Human Services
51.title: Treatment For Patients With Terminal Illness -- The Neil Fachon Terminally Ill Patients' Right To Try Act Of 2021
51.description: Creates the "Neil Fachon Terminally Ill Patients' Right To Try Act of 2021," which establishes the conditions for the use of experimental treatments for terminally ill patients.

53.title: Fundraising For Public Schools
53.description: Allows a school district to assess or request a voluntary contribution of money from a student or the student's parent or legal guardian to make a donation, in whole or in part, for the cost of district-sponsored field trips, dances, and clubs.

54.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
54.title: Life-saving Allergy Medication--stock Syringe Epinephrine Auto-injectors--emergency Administration
54.description: Requires owners or operators of enclosed public space holding 300 or more people to have available epinephrine auto injectors and personnel trained to administer them.

55.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
55.title: Establishing The Rhode Island Rare Disease Medication Accessibility, Affordability, And Reinsurance Act
55.description: Provides for establishment of the rare disease medication reinsurance program to be funded by insurer contributions that would be administered by the secretary of health and human services based on recommendations from a 15 member advisory council.

56.title: Compensation For Students Participating In Intercollegiate Athletics
56.description: Expressly allows college athletes, while they are students, to personally profit from the use of their name, image, and likeness, and prohibits the NCAA from preventing these practices.

57.title: Feminine Hygiene Products
57.description: Provides that feminine hygiene products be provided in all public schools and prisons.

58.title: Identification And Apprehension Of Criminals
58.description: Allows for the sealing of records pertaining to cases for which a person is acquitted or otherwise exonerated from a charged offense and eliminates the one hundred dollar ($100) fee for the expungement of a criminal record.

59.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
59.title: Sentence And Execution
59.description: Requires termination of imprisonment on a deferred sentence when, after consideration by an assistant or special assistant designated by the attorney general, the state or arresting police department, in their discretion, dismisses the charge(s).

61.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
61.title: Corrections Department
61.description: Requires the executive branch or the department of corrections to report its findings and recommendations regarding the justice reinvestment policies or the department of corrections, to the legislature on or before April 1, of each year.

62.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
62.title: Bail And Recognizance
62.description: Repeals § 12-13-5.1 which permits the state to draw an inference that a person charged with delivery of a controlled substance is a danger to the community.

64.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
64.title: Procedure In Particular Actions -- Post Conviction Remedy
64.description: Allows a person who has been convicted on the basis, in whole or in part, on scientific evidence that has been found or otherwise determined to be discredited by the scientific community, eligible to seek post-conviction relief on that ground.

65.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
65.title: Relating Courts And Civil Procedure - Procedure Generally - Witnesses
65.description: Requires, upon motion by counsel in criminal proceeding, attorney general or lead investigating law enforcement agency to issue subpoena or warrant to social media and internet sites for production of material posted or submitted by potential witness.

66.title: Passive Voluntary Adoption Mutual Consent Registry Act -- Adoption Of Children
66.description: Directs the department of health to provide information regarding the passive voluntary adoption reunion registry on the department of health's website and in the division of vital records.

67.title: Passing, Use Of Lanes, And Rules Of The Road
67.description: Provides for specific fines and sanctions to operators of motor vehicles who fail to exercise due care to avoid colliding with a vulnerable road user causing injury, serious injury, or death to the vulnerable road user.

68.title: Motor Vehicle Offenses
68.description: Grants a judge or magistrate the discretion to impose the requirement of blood and/or urine testing or the use of the ignition interlock system.

70.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
70.title: Vaccination Jumping
70.description: Makes it unlawful for health care facilities or their workers to circumvent the state's COVID-19 vaccination schedule.

71.title: Board Of Medical Licensure And Discipline
71.description: Increases the maximum fine amount for those found guilty of unprofessional conduct by the board of medical licensure and discipline from $10,000 to $30,000, and establishes a new chapter of the general laws which gives board the authority to levy fines.

72.last_action: Referred to Senate Housing and Municipal Government
72.title: Relating To Public Property And Works
72.description: Prohibits any development of land contiguous to the State House unless approved by the general assembly.

73.title: Validating And Ratifying Amendment To The Charter Of The Town Of Jamestown
73.description: Ratifies the town of Jamestown Home Rule Charter amendment to Section 219 of the charter adopted at a November 3, 2020 referendum, concerning the process and procedures by which voter initiative can be activated.

74.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
74.title: Authorizing The Exeter-west Greenwich Regional School District To Issue Not To Exceed $17,840,000 General Obligation Bonds And Notes To Finance The Renovation, Rehabilitation, Improvement, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The District, Including, But Not Limited To, Auditorium And Classroom Improvements, Information Technology, Roofs, Floors, Heating, Ventilation, Air Conditioning, Electrical Systems, Playgrounds, Athletic Facilities, Parking And Safety Improvements, Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By The Amount Of Certain Grants Received From State Bond Proceeds, From The Rhode Island Department Of Education Or From The Rhode Island School Building Authority
74.description: Authorizes the Exeter-West Greenwich Regional School District to issue general obligation bonds not to exceed $17,840,000 for school improvements.

76.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
76.title: State Purchases
76.description: Allows state colleges to sell discarded or surplus technology to their students at discounted prices, using the monies collected to purchase updated electronic equipment or technology.

77.title: Retail Licenses
77.description: Authorizes Class B license holder to sell specified limits of wine, beer and mixed alcoholic beverages with take out orders, however, all other alcoholic beverages prohibited with sunset on 12/31/21.

78.last_action: Referred to Senate Housing and Municipal Government
78.title: Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes
78.description: Allows the town of Johnston to adopt a tax classification plan independent of the provisions of § 44-5-11.8.

79.title: Retirement Of Municipal Employees--middletown Municipal Employees Retirement
79.description: Allows the town of Middletown to enroll its full-time police officers hired on or after July 1, 2021, in a defined contribution plan established by the town and prevents newly hired police officers from becoming members of the retirement system.

82.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
82.title: Sales And Use Taxes--enforcement And Collection
82.description: Provides that any person who has a retail sales permit would not be required to pay a separate registration fee to make sales at flea markets; provided, however, the person would remain responsible to pay all taxes due as a result of sales at a flea mkt.

83.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
83.title: Civil Air Patrol Act
83.description: Authorizes state aide to RICAP for training/equipment for use during times of natural disaster/emergency as needed by state EMA/governor.

84.title: Medical Assistance - Long-term Care Services And Finance Reforms
84.description: Requires that the rate for hospice providers, delivering hospice care in a skilled nursing facility, not exceed ninety-five percent (95%) of the rate paid for non-hospice care in a skilled nursing facility.

85.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
85.title: Miniature Alcoholic Beverage Container Act Of 2021
85.description: Creates a refundable fifty cent ($0.50) deposit for miniature alcoholic beverage containers, often referred to as "nips."

86.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (05/06/2021)
86.title: Preceptors Tax Credit Act
86.description: Allows for a tax credit of $500 for certain nurse practitioners or physicians.

87.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
87.title: Home Community Care Services To The Elderly
87.description: Expands eligibility for elderly services assistance to persons under age 65 suffering from physician confirmed Alzheimer's disease related dementia with income not to exceed 250% of federal poverty level.

89.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
89.title: Education Assistance And Development Tax Credit
89.description: Creates a tax credit for the amount in excess of ten thousand dollars ($10,000) contributed to a public school district for the express purpose of making physical improvements to a school.

90.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
90.title: Payments To Fire Companies
90.description: Provides for an appropriation of state funds to cities and towns who are members of the Narragansett Bay marine task force (NBMTF) for the maintenance of boats providing services to Narragansett Bay.

91.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
91.title: State Aid
91.description: Addresses general assembly appropriations in lieu of property taxes for state-owned properties within the town of Exeter and sets aside such payments to establish newly created municipal police departments.

92.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
92.title: Economic And Climate Resilience Act Of 2020
92.description: Imposes carbon tax on fossil fuel sellers for use in climate resilience/renewable energy/energy efficiency/climate adaption programs effective upon 3 states adoption covered by RGGI.

93.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
93.title: Relating To Taxation
93.description: Provides a tax credit for state community service hours provided by state residents to certain not-for-profit entities and municipal departments.

94.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/15/2021)
94.title: Relating To Goddard State Park
94.description: Requires the department of environmental management to install certain moorings at Goddard State Park.

95.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
95.title: State Emblems
95.description: Designate the music genre of rhythm and blues as the state music.

96.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
96.title: Coastal And Riverine Home Protection
96.description: Enables cities and towns to provide a tax exemption to individuals who take resiliency measures to rehabilitate their property because of flood hazards.

97.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
97.title: Hemp Growth Act
97.description: Authorizes cities and towns to enact ordinances to address and protect their citizens' public safety and welfare from the impact of hemp cultivation and any of its derivative products.

98.title: Size, Weight And Load Limits -- Middletown
98.description: Prohibits the operation of through commercial vehicles on Turner Road in Middletown.

99.title: Abandonment Of Roads
99.description: Authorizes the town of Middletown, upon receiving a request for the abandonment of a highway from an abutting property owner, to buy the abandoned highway from the abutting owner, at fair market value.

100.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
100.title: Zoning Ordinances
100.description: Provides for the preservation of housing density when a municipality allows alternative uses within a residential zone. Transferal of the residential density would be to locations at the discretion of the municipality.

101.title: Property Subject To Taxation
101.description: Exempts from taxation the real property of Ocean State Community Wellness, Inc., a qualified tax-exempt corporation under § 501(c)(3) of the United States Internal Revenue Code, for the property located at 7450 Post Road, North Kingstown, Rhode Island.

103.title: Single-use Plastic Straws
103.description: Prohibits a food service establishment from providing a consumer with a single-use plastic straw, unless the consumer requests such a straw.

104.title: Biodiesel Products
104.description: Amends the compliance standards for heating oil biobased products providing minimum standards for the percentage of biobased product that certain types of heating oil must contain.

105.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
105.title: Refuse Disposal
105.description: Requires certain businesses and educational facilities that produce at least fifty-two (52) tons of organic-waste yearly and are located within thirty (30) miles of an authorized composting facility to use authorized methods of recycling.

106.title: Energy Facility Siting Act
106.description: Amends provisions relative to the energy facility siting act including designating the public utilities commission as the public advocate and would create certain pre-application requirements.

107.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
107.title: The Geoengineering Act
107.description: Establishes licensing procedure for persons seeking to engage in geoengineering activity from DEM to protect health/safety/environment of state.

108.title: Hunting And Hunting Safety
108.description: Requires any person who sustains an injury to themselves or causes an injury to another while hunting or trapping to report the injury to the department of environmental management immediately.

110.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
110.title: Disposable Food Service Containers
110.description: Prohibits a covered establishment from preparing, selling, processing or providing food or beverages in or on a disposable food service container that is composed in whole or in part of polystyrene foam.

111.title: Abused And Neglected Children
111.description: Requires the department of children, youth and families to report all suspected cases of child sexual abuse to the children's advocacy center.

112.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
112.title: Relating To State Affairs And Government-law Enforcement Officers' Bill Of Rights
112.description: Amends the law enforcement officers’ bill of rights to require that a person wishing to serve as a third member of a hearing committee attend training and would amend the suspension period for minor violations and the appeals procedure.

113.title: Sexual Assault
113.description: Increases the age of children able to utilize a recorded forensic interview for cases of sexual abuse in grand jury testimony -- child assault from age fourteen (14) to age eighteen (18).

114.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
114.title: Rhode Island Campaign Contributions And Expenditures Reporting
114.description: Requires all candidates for office to file the same number of campaign finance reports, all due at the same times, whether or not they have contested primary elections.

115.title: Causes Of Action
115.description: Expands the definition of the word "perpetrator defendant" for purposes of bringing a civil action based upon sexual abuse or exploitation of a child.

116.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
116.title: Correctional Institutions -- Parole
116.description: Makes minors who were sentenced as adults, eligible for parole after serving fifteen (15) years of a sentence and applies to those prisoners whose offenses were committed on or after January 1, 1991.

117.title: Police Officers - Commission On Standards And Training
117.description: Requires the commission on standards and training to provide training and instructions for police officers and trainees in order to more accurately identify complaints involving persons with cognitive or communication-related disabilities.

118.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
118.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies
118.description: Requires all health insurance providers offering prescription drug benefits to limit person’s out-of-pocket costs to$100 for 30 day supply. Commencing 1/1/22.

119.title: Genetic Counselors Licensing Act
119.description: Provides a statutory framework for the licensing and regulation of genetic counselors.

120.title: The Rhode Island Broadband Development Program
120.description: Establishes the 11 member broadband council to create a plan to increase the use of broadband service in the state. A broadband coordinator is to be designated in Commerce RI to access federal funds and coordinate with the council.

121.title: Inspections
121.description: Authorizes the Exeter town sergeant or designees to conduct division of motor vehicles vehicle identifying number and odometer inspections.

122.title: General Regulatory Provisions -- Indecent Deceptive Trade Practices, Duties Of Carriers, Community Standards Of Decency, Adult Entertainment Establishments -- Human Trafficking And Child Exploitation Prevention Act
122.description: Mandates retailers that manufacture and internet based device prior to sale to block websites that facilitate or display obscene material.

123.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
123.title: Rhode Island Food, Drugs, And Cosmetics Act
123.description: Limits insured persons insulin costs to $25 per month.

124.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
124.title: Sanitation In Food Establishments
124.description: Defines what constitutes a multi-use food and beverage storage container and provides for sanitary use of said containers.

125.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
125.title: Rhode Island Pathways Project
125.description: Requires the executive office of health and human services (EOHHS) to conduct a study to assess the impact of using Medicaid funds to provide coverage for the treatment of the chronically homeless.

126.title: The Healing Art Of Acupuncture And Oriental Medicine
126.description: Changes title of chapter 37.2 of title 5 and throughout, replacing the words "Oriental medicine" with "Chinese medicine". Allows individuals who are otherwise certified, to practice acupuncture & Chinese medicine using Chinese medical diagnostic methods.

127.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
127.title: Mental Health Law
127.description: Includes licensed advanced practice registered nurses (APRN), certified in psychiatric/mental health, as qualified to certify the need for mental health treatment in certain patients.

128.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
128.title: The Breast Cancer Act
128.description: Amends the current law so that digital breast tomosynthesis (dbt) screenings are available wherever mammograms are conducted and to provide insurance coverage for such screenings.

130.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
130.title: Rhode Island Early Educator Investment Act
130.description: Requires the children’s cabinet, in conjunction with the department of education, to develop and implement strategies to improve the compensation of early educators.

132.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
132.title: Health Care Accessibility And Quality Assurance Act
132.description: Redefines the term "covered services" as used to describe applicable subscriber agreements between a health care entity and a dentist.

133.title: Suicide Treatment Improvement Act
133.description: Provides for the “Suicide Treatment Improvement Act” to improve the delivery of suicide treatment.

134.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
134.title: Physician Assistants
134.description: Expands the rights of physician assistants with regard to their practice and prohibits non-compete clauses that exceed five years with regard to the purchase and sale of a practice.

135.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
135.title: Licensing Of Health Care Facilities -- The Hospital Conversion Act
135.description: Expands the health services council from twelve (12) to twenty-four (24) members and amends the hospital conversion act relative to disclosure.

136.title: Health And Safety Of Pupils
136.description: Allows students in public schools to possess and use a topical sunscreen product. Children enrolled in grades K-5 would need a note from a parent or guardian in order to possess sunscreen on school property.

137.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
137.title: Animal Care
137.description: Authorizes emergency medical service providers to transport and provide first aid to police dogs injured in the line of duty.

138.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
138.title: Rhode Island Best Rx Prescription Drug Discount Program For The Uninsured
138.description: Requires that enrollees in the Rhode Island best RX Prescription drug discount program for the uninsured are not charged a copay for their prescriptions.

139.title: Preservation Of Families With Disabled Parent
139.description: Precludes the disability of a parent from serving as a basis for denial or restriction in matters involving a child's welfare, foster care, family law, guardianship and adoption without written findings by the family court.

140.title: Relating To Solemnization Of Marriages
140.description: Allows Meghan E. McEntee to join Courtney Lee Adham and Gian France Isé-Russo in marriage on or about February 14, 2021, within the Town of Wakefield, Rhode Island.

142.title: Rhode Island Veterans' Home
142.description: Changes the service requirement for admissions to RI Veterans' Home from 90 days to 2 years, and gives priority to veterans defined as war veterans.

143.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
143.title: Firefighters' Arbitration
143.description: Continues all provisions of expired firefighters' collective bargaining agreements until a successor agreement is reached between the parties or an interest arbitration award is rendered.

144.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

504.description: Requires vehicle owners with electronic vehicle recovery systems to submit affidavit attesting to theft prior to law enforcement contact with provider for aid in locating vehicle.

506.title: Divorce And Separation
506.description: Creates a custody procedure for pets in divorce and separation proceedings based on the best interests of the animal. This act would not apply to assistance/service animals.

507.title: Procedure In Particular Actions - Death By Wrongful Act
507.description: Allows recovery of damages for the emotional distress, grief, and loss of enjoyment of life as a result of the wrongful death of a spouse, a parent or a son or daughter.

509.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
509.title: Parental And Family Medical Leave
509.description: Grants unpaid pregnancy leave to part-time workers, would clarify their access to unpaid sick leave during their pregnancy, and would provide additional protections for pregnant workers who work in the medical field.

513.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
513.title: Transportation Network Company Service
513.description: Allows New Shoreham to regulate transportation network company services.

514.title: New Shoreham Affordable Housing Eligibility
514.description: Increases the percentage of area median income from one hundred twenty percent (120%) to one hundred forty percent (140%) only for New Shoreham residents to make more households eligible for affordable housing.

517.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
517.title: Emergency Shelters
517.description: Establishes rules and procedures for licensing emergency shelters, including setting minimum standards and prohibiting the charging of fees to the residents.

518.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
518.title: First Responders
518.description: Establishes March 17 as an annual day of special observance to honor Rhode Island's first responders.

519.title: Holley Landing
519.description: Renames the landing in South Kingstown known as Wordens Pond Landing to Holley Landing.

520.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
520.title: Relating To Holidays And Days Of Special Observance
520.description: Sets aside the twenty-seventh day of October annually to be known as Dr. Ernest Finocchio Day.

521.title: Statewide Public Safety Computer Aided Dispatch Records Management System
521.description: Establishes a statewide public safety computer aided dispatch records management system.

522.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
522.title: Uniform Unsworn Declaration Act
522.description: Gives an "unsworn" declaration given under the penalty of perjury the same effect as "a sworn" declaration, and subject to the criminal penalties for perjury.

523.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
523.title: Department Of Business Regulation--automobile Wrecking And Salvage Yards
523.description: Prohibits any entity/individual from advertising sale/purchase/receipt/transport/salvage of junks/discarded vehicle unless done by licensed auto wrecking/salvage yard subject to civil fines.

524.title: Public Accountancy
524.description: Eliminates the words "moral turpitude" as a cause of refusal to issue a license to various professionals.

525.title: Conduct Of Election And Voting Equipment, And Supplies
525.description: Includes the general assembly elections within the category of elections subject to the risk- limiting audits within the jurisdiction of the board of elections.

526.title: General Regulatory Provisions -- Unfair Sales Practices
526.description: Prohibits automatic renewal of contracts for personal, family or household purposes unless the consumer signs a consent to renew within sixty (60) days of the contract expiration date.

527.title: Video-lottery Games, Table Games And Sports Wagering
527.description: Established player self-exclusion program with winnings collected from self-excluded players going to RICPG for research/education/prevention of teenage gambling addiction.

530.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
530.title: Rhode Island Promise Scholarship
530.description: Provides that the students with disabilities shall be eligible to participate in the state's promise scholarship program and provided with reasonable accommodations to access the opportunities.

531.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
531.title: Sales And Use Taxes--liability And Computation
531.description: Exempts the trade-in value of pickup trucks under eight thousand one hundred pounds (8,100 lbs.) gross weight, used exclusively for personal use, from sales tax.

534.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
534.title: Artificial Propagation Of Game
534.description: Prohibits captive hunting and the possession, the sale, breeding or importation of any mammal for the purpose of captive hunting.

535.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
535.title: Pharmacies -- Prescriptions
535.description: Requires pharmacists to notify their customers whether their cost sharing benefits exceed the actual retail price of the prescription sought, in the absence of prescription drug coverage.

536.title: The Consumer Protection In Eye Care Act
536.description: Provides for consumer protection in eye care services by developing standards and enforcement protocols related to the utilization of assessment mechanisms in the provision of eye care services.

537.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
537.title: Law Enforcement Officers' Bill Of Rights
537.description: Increases committee in law enforcement officers’ bill of rights hearing to 5, three as permanent. Hearings commenced in 15 days, allow for summary suspension of 5 days and would mandate pay suspended while the case is pending.

539.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
539.title: Computer Crime
539.description: Allows for a civil action against parents of a student who demonstrates disregard for the suspension of their child who has committed the offense of cyberstalking or cyberharassment.

542.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
542.title: Contested Pet Ownership
542.description: Creates a legal process by which formerly cohabitating parties could seek from the district court a determination as to ownership of any pet.

543.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
543.title: Employment Of Women And Children
543.description: Requires children who seek a special limited work permit to successfully complete a training program which shall address workers' rights, workplace health and safety, and workers' compensation, to be established and funded by the DLT.

544.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/04/2021)
544.title: Relating To Jewish Seniors Agency Of Rhode Island
544.description: Increases the authorized holdings of Jewish Seniors Agency of Rhode Island to two million dollars ($2,000,000) and exempt the same from taxation.

546.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
546.title: Emergency Volunteer Health Practitioners Act
546.description: Permits medical/vets services by health care volunteers during emergency.

548.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
548.title: Primaries
548.description: Requires that on all primaries, the candidate's names would be listed in an order chosen by lot under the direction of the secretary of state.

549.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
549.title: The Climate Literacy Act
549.description: Implements literacy of climate change for all students enrolled in public schools or other schools managed and controlled by the state in kindergarten through twelve (K-12).

550.title: Proper Management Of Unused Paint
550.description: Requires DEM to request proposals every 2 years to solicit representative organization to operate paint stewardship program.

551.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
551.title: Relating To Motor And Other Vehicles
551.description: Creates a low emission diesel standard used to power a diesel fueled compression-ignition internal combustion engine and would take effect December 1, 2021.

552.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
552.title: Comprehensive Health Insurance Program
552.description: Establishes a universal, comprehensive, affordable single-payer health care insurance program which shall be referred to as, "the Rhode Island Comprehensive Health Insurance Program" (RICHIP)

553.title: 911 Emergency Telephone Number Act
553.description: Establishes an emergency telephone system call review and quality improvement and would require at least one 911 system operator trained in telecommunicator cardiopulmonary resuscitation be on duty at all time.

554.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
554.title: Automobile Accident Social Protection Act
554.description: Creates an accident compensation fund to provide payments and benefits to those injured by uninsured motorists, to be administered by the department of human services.

555.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
555.title: Highway Safety Act
555.description: Amend several chapters regarding the operation of bikes on state highways and interaction with motor vehicles, aggressive honking, regulation of E-bikes, reckless driver accountability program & speed limits in thickly settled areas/business districts.

557.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
557.title: Ordinances
557.description: Allows cities and towns to create ordinances to regulate use and sale of cigarettes and other tobacco products.

559.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
559.title: Expungement Of Criminal Records-- Identification And Apprehension Of Criminals
559.description: Act repeals fee payment for expungements and makes eligible persons convicted of felony simple possession for expungement 5 years after completion of sentence.

560.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
560.title: General Powers
560.description: Repeals the power granted to certain municipal courts to execute search warrants to the extent the warrants could be executed by a judge of the district court.

561.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
561.title: Freeways
561.description: Exempts the operation of construction vehicles performing authorized public works functions from the prohibition on operating their vehicle in reverse on roadways.

564.title: Pesticide Control
564.description: Prohibits the use of neonicotinoids which are a class of insecticides.

565.title: The Elder Adult Financial Exploitation Prevention Act
565.description: Requires employees of regulated financial institutions to report suspected financial exploitation of elder adults to the office of healthy aging and provide authority to the regulated financial institution to place a temporary hold on transactions.

566.title: Insurers' Rehabilitation And Liquidation Act
566.description: Updates a portion of the Insurance Receivership statute to the current National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) standards.

567.title: Condominium Law -- Resale Of Units
567.description: Allows a condominium association to impose a fee of up to one hundred twenty-five dollars ($125) for preparation of a resale certificate.

568.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (03/18/2021)
568.title: Housing Maintenance And Occupancy Code
568.description: Landlords responsible to tenants if tenants evicted due to landlord neglect and allows municipality to place lien on property.

570.title: Breast Cancer Patient Notification
570.description: Now allows for a summary of a patient's mammography report be provided to the patient by mail, electronically, or otherwise.

571.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
571.title: Bail Hearings
571.description: Entitles criminal defendants charged with enumerated serious criminal offenses to a bail hearing within 14 calendar days of their initial court appearance.

572.title: Rhode Island Holocaust And Genocide Education Commission
572.description: Creates the Holocaust and genocide education commission.

573.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
573.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies -- Lifetime Limits
573.description: Revokes the authority of the health insurance commissioner's ability to enforce a ruling of the federal government or federal court that revokes the prohibition on limits on health insurance.

574.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
574.title: Rhode Island Sanctuary State Act
574.description: Designates schools, places of worship and courts as sensitive locations and would require that a judicial warrant be obtained before federal immigration authorities could be granted access to those premises to enforce immigration laws.

575.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
575.title: Comprehensive Community--police Relationship Act Of 2015
575.description: Data collection on police traffic stops and/or searches. Requires appointment of community review board.

576.title: Naming State Constructions -- E. Richard Durfee Road
576.description: Name a certain portion of Sand Hill Cove Road in Narragansett, "E. Richard Durfee Road".

577.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
577.title: Teacher's Retirement
577.description: Allows teachers, state and municipal employees to retire upon the earlier of reaching age sixty (60) with thirty (30) years of service or the employee's retirement eligibility date under present state statutes.

578.title: To Amend The Language Of The Lease Of The Benefit Street Armory Between The State Of Rhode Island And The Providence Marine Corps Of Artillery
578.description: Authorizes the Department of Administration to amend lease to Providence Marine Corps of Artillery to use hall for promotion of the arsenal and to sublease the rented space.

579.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
579.title: Community College Apprentice Tax Credit
579.description: Creates tax credit up to $3,500 per year for employers of qualifying apprentices commencing after 12/31/21 with 3 year carry forward provision

580.title: Office Of Library And Information Services -- State Aid To Libraries
580.description: Amends various sections relating to libraries to remove outdated provisions and update language to reflect current practices affecting library technology.

581.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
581.title: Relating To Human Services
581.description: Increases the reimbursement rates to be paid by the department of human services and the department for children, youth, and families, for licensed child care centers and family child care homes.

582.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
582.title: Office Of Energy Resources Interconnection Standards
582.description: Transfers from the electric distribution companies to the Infrastructure Bank planning and administration of the interconnection of renewable energy to the electric distribution system.

583.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
583.title: The Green Justice Zone Act
583.description: Establishes the first Green Justice Zone, a model that may be replicated in future years to ensure that all communities throughout the state have clean air and clean water.

584.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
584.title: The Russell Act Of 2021
584.description: Allows participating municipalities to elect to its employees the deferred compensation plans offered by the state.

588.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
588.title: Teachers' Retirement
588.description: SEE TITLE 16 CHAPTER 97-THE RHODE ISLAND BOARD OF EDUCATION ACT) (Replaces the suspension year COLA for all retired teachers, state employees and municipal with a fractional COLA award of twenty-five percent (25%).

589.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
589.title: State Building Code
589.description: Increases the levy on total construction costs that cities and towns may charge for building permits and directs that fifty percent (50%) each of the levy be transmitted monthly to the department of labor and training for workforce training.

592.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

592.description: Reduces the eligibility requirement for many prospective members of the Rhode Island Works' Program making it easier for some to qualify for its benefits.

594.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
594.title: Department Of Administration--state Construction Projects Metrics
594.description: Requires that the division of planning create a checklist of environmental and energy issues that certain state construction projects which cost in excess of $10,000,000 need to consider and address.

595.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

595.description: Repeals the provisions of the general laws allowing deferred deposit providers, also known as "payday lenders."

597.title: Relating To Coventry Sewer Authority
597.description: Prohibits the town of Coventry from assessing the costs of repaving the roadway upon the completion of any sewage works upon the land owners.

598.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

598.description: Eliminates the exception the current law gives to Woonsocket regarding the composition of city or town school committees.

600.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

600.description: Gives Rhode Island businesses bidders on municipal contracts a priority if their bid is within three percent (3%) of the lowest bidder as long as the contract is not funded by federal money.

601.description: Transfers ownership of the sewer infrastructure in the city of Central Falls to the Narragansett Bay Commission.

603.last_action: Referred to Senate Special Legislation and Veterans Affairs

605.description: Authorizes the town of South Kingstown to issue not more than $85,000,000 bonds and notes to finance the construction, renovation, improvement, alteration, repair, landscaping, furnishing and equipping of schools and school facilities.

606.description: Requires implementation of education courses in African American history in elementary and secondary schools in Rhode Island commencing in the 2022-2023 school year.

609.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
609.title: Student Privacy On School-owned Technology
609.description: Provides that no educational institution without an opt-in shall compel students to participate in a take-home technology program (e.g., computers).

613.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
613.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies -- Step Therapy Protocols
613.description: Requires health insurers that issue prescription drug coverage to use step therapy protocols.

614.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
614.title: Interstate Compact To Award Prizes For Curing Diseases
614.description: Adopts the Interstate Compact to Award Prizes for Curing Diseases.

623.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

623.description: Expands the Rite Track Program to provide health care coverage to children up to age nineteen (19) funded by federal funds, if available, or if not available, by state funds.

625.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

629.description: Increases the amount of parental or family leave available to an employee from thirteen (13) weeks to twenty-six (26) weeks in any two (2) calendar years.

631.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

631.description: Requires bidders on public school construction contracts of $5,000,000 or more to have an apprenticeships program compliant with chapter and truthful reporting of program data to DOLT effective July 1, 2021.

632.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

632.description: Incorporates the federal affirmative action and nondiscrimination obligations of federal contractors and subcontractors regarding individuals with disabilities into the Rhode Island equal opportunity and affirmative action law.

633.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

633.description: Authorizes wire tap application for Human Trafficking offense investigations.

634.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
634.title: Sexual Abuse Or Exploitation Of A Child
634.description: Defines the term "perpetrator defendant" for purpose of actions based on sexual abuse of a child.

636.title: Department Of Attorney General
636.description: Requires the office of the attorney general to issue a report containing the total cases charged with a firearm in all Rhode Island courts and a list of cases charged with a firearm which have been disposed during the calendar year.

637.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

637.description: Authorizes state police to provide retention/storage of municipal police officers body camera footage.

639.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

642.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

642.description: Prohibits a landlord from asking about the immigration status of a tenant, prospective tenant, occupant, or prospective occupant of residential rental property.

643.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
643.title: Public Utilities

645.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

645.description: Enhances the penalties for the violation of any law, rule or regulation relating to wild animals.

648.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
648.title: Restrictive Housing At Correctional Facilities Act
648.description: Establishes conditions, policies and procedures for the restrictive housing of inmates at correctional facilities in Rhode Island with the least restrictive conditions possible.

650.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

650.description: Eliminates competing reporting requirements relating to referenda and consolidate all reporting requirements concerning the independent expenditures and electioneering communications for elections.

651.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
651.title: Nomination Of Party And Independent Candidates
651.description: Allows voters to endorse nomination of candidacy documents by mail, email, or facsimile and deliver to the candidate or board of canvassers in-person, via mail, email or facsimile.

652.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

652.description: Creates early in-person voting and online applications for mail ballots. It removes the two (2) witnesses' notarization of voter signature for mail ballots.

653.description: Provides an exception to the requirements of competitive sealed bidding for local, minority and woman-owned business enterprises.

655.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

655.description: Requires state and national criminal background checks person volunteering or interning at any elementary or secondary educational institution. It would also waive fees for background checks employment with salary of less than forty thousand dollars.

656.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
656.title: Municipal Detention Facility Corporations
656.description: Prohibits the operation of private detention facilities and private public partnerships within the state and prohibits the housing of Rhode Island prisoners in other states as well as hold out-of-state prisoners in Rhode Island facilities.

660.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
660.title: Registration Of Voters
660.description: Increases the role of the division of motor vehicles in the voter registration and address verification process, by establishing very specific obligations.

661.title: Sunset Advisory Commission
661.description: Exempts permanently and totally disabled applicants with income below three hundred percent (300%) of the federal poverty line, from the income and resource eligibility rules, regulations and limits.

664.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
664.title: Food And Drugs -- Sanitation In Food Establishments -- Home Food Manufacture Act
664.description: Amends the current law that allows farmers to sell produce directly to consumers by directing the department of health to permit home food manufacture and sales direct to consumers.

665.title: Dry Dock Facilities
665.description: Amends the lien and notice procedures for facility operators of dry dock facilities.

666.title: Relating To Agriculture And Forestry
666.description: Creates a forest conservation commission, to be coordinated with the department of environmental management, to seek new funding and identify incentives for landowners to maintain their land as forest.

667.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
667.title: Family Farm Protection Act

668.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
668.title: Renewable Energy Standard
668.description: Sets forth new renewable energy standards.

671.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
671.title: Excavation Near Underground Utility Facilities
671.description: Requires any public utility or its contractor to reimburse an excavator for lost time expense incurred, including manpower and equipment from the utility's incorrect marking of underground utilities.

672.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
672.title: Architects
672.description: Allows superior court to require person affixing architectural stamp within five (5) years, to provide evidence that services were performed by entity named in the "certificate" or "certificate of authorization."

674.title: Roofing Contractors
674.description: Amends the registration and licensure requirements of roofing contractors.

677.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
677.title: Prohibition On Live Markets
677.description: Prohibits the granting of any business licenses to any person, firm, partnership or corporation that operates a live market where consumers can buy freshly slaughtered meat or fowl.

678.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

678.description: Requires the health insurance commissioner to adopt a uniform set of medical criteria for prior authorization and create a required form to be used by a health insurer.

681.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
681.title: Parking Facilities And Privileges
681.description: Requires motor vehicle parking spaces specifically designed for persons transporting young children under the age of three (3) and baby strollers.

682.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
682.title: Powers And Operations
682.description: Prohibits financial institutions from investing in private detention centers or continuing to invest with any institution, company or subsidiary of a company that owns or contracts with a government entity to manage or run a prison.

683.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
683.title: Business Notification Act
683.description: Requires businesses to be notified of any regulatory changes which materially impact the business.

684.title: Financial Institutions Creation And Expansion
684.description: Amends provisions relating to receiverships/licensing. Security bonds, reporting requirements, resident agent to eliminate same requirement/clarify language to reduce burden on financial businesses.

685.title: Surplus Lines Insurance
685.description: Clarifies surplus lines licensing and eliminate an unnecessary bond requirement, eliminate the need for an "in person" hearing in an appeal of a classification and add additional lines of insurance to the Commercial Special Risks statute.

686.description: Updates the Credit for Reinsurance, Risk Based Capital and Insurance Holding Company statutes to the current National Association of Insurance Commissioners standard.

687.title: Establishing An Elected And Appointed Minority Officials Commission
687.description: Creates Elected/Appointed Minority Officials Commission to create record of minority officials from 1636 to present.

689.title: Registration Of Vehicles -- Special Plate For Masonic Grand Lodge Charities Of Rhode Island
689.description: Authorizes a special license plate for MASONIC GRAND LODGE CHARITIES OF RHODE ISLAND, specify the minimum order, and govern the amount and distribution of the fee surcharge.

691.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

691.description: Creates a tax credit for the purchase of a qualified gun safe, not to exceed $1,000. It would also exempt gun safes from the sales tax.

692.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
692.title: Equality In Abortion Coverage
692.description: Provides for abortion coverage in the Medicaid program and repeal the abortion coverage exclusion for state employee insurance plans.

693.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
693.title: Rhode Island Pay For Success Act

694.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
694.title: Temporary Disability Insurance -- General Provisions
694.description: Increases taxable wage base for employee contributions to TDI/TCI fund/individual benefit rates for eligible individuals/maximum caregiver weeks/creates new credit for low wage tax payers not income eligible to receive benefits. Effective 1/1/22.

695.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
695.title: Health Care For Elderly And Disabled
695.description: Increases the income eligibility limit for medical assistance coverage for seniors and disabled individuals from one hundred percent (100%) to one hundred thirty-three percent (133%) of federal poverty level.

698.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

698.description: Provides medical home care base rate adjustments and keeps high acuity or high medical necessity patients out of skilled nursing facilities and hospitals and remain safe at home with well trained and stable long-term care support.

700.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

700.description: Establishes the office of inspector general as an independent administrative agency charged with the responsibility to investigate, detect, and prevent fraud, waste, abuse, and mismanagement in the expenditure of public funds.

701.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

701.description: Establishes the livable home modification grant fund to provide individuals with severe disabilities financial assistance to modify their homes.

704.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
