704.description: Imposes a fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) for the registration of a camping recreational vehicle.

705.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
705.title: School Funds And Property
705.description: Establishes a pilot program to promote the creation of roof solar installations on school property in order to reduce the use of fossil fuels and to generate electricity in school buildings.

706.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
706.title: Senior Center Building Capital Fund
706.description: Creates senior center building capital fund to provide cities and towns with financial assistance up to thirty percent of the construction cost of the project.

707.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
707.title: Payday Loans
707.description: Caps the APR for payday loans at 28%. Requires 90 day maturity date. Prohibits fees/interest payments in excess of 60% of principal. Requires monthly payments of no more than 25% of original principal amount.

708.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
708.title: Revenue Estimating Conferences
708.description: Changes the dates of the Revenue Estimating Conferences meeting to the last ten (10) days of April and the first ten (10) days of November of each year.

709.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
709.title: Housing Resources -- Homeless Shelters
709.description: Creates a commission to establish homeless shelter standards through regulations.

714.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
714.title: The Percentage Of Income Home Energy Affordability Act
714.description: Creates the Percentage of Income Home Energy Affordability Program, an income-sensitive tiered subsidy program to ensure that home energy utility costs are affordable for eligible low-income households.

715.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
715.title: State Budget
715.description: Requires that the governor submit a zero-based budget to the general assembly. The zero-based budget shall be phased in over a five (5) year period.

716.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
716.title: Medical Assistance And Public Assistance Caseload Estimating Conferences
716.description: Requires the participation and input of the EOHHS, DHS, DCYF and BHDDH in medical assistance and public assistance caseload estimating conferences and the generation of monthly data to the members of the case load estimating conference.

717.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
717.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Liability And Computation
717.description: Exempts from the sales and use tax that portion of a motor vehicle lease payment collected for tangible personal property tax, municipal property tax, excise, or any other similar tax.

720.title: Emergency Police Power
720.description: Authorizes higher education institution department to enter into an agreement with any city/town to provide police assistance in non emergency situations.

726.title: Validating And Ratifying The 2020 Amendments To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of Smithfield
726.description: Validating And Ratifying The 2020 Amendments To The Home Rule Charter Of The Town Of Smithfield

727.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
727.title: Department Of State -- Award Of Municipal Contracts
727.description: Provides that the secretary of state establish a registry for publication of municipal invitations for bids and that municipalities publish notice of invitations for bids with the registry.

728.title: Residence Of Children For School Purposes
728.description: Military personnel ordered to Rhode Island may register their children for school remotely.

729.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
729.title: Purple-star Rhode Island Dependent Education Act
729.description: Establishes the "Purple-star Rhode Island Education Act" or "PRIDE" Act.

730.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
730.title: The Statewide Virtual Education Act [see Title 16 Chapter 97 -- The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
730.description: Children/ Students of military service members transferring to or from Rhode Island may attend by virtual learning.

732.title: School Committee And Superintendents
732.description: Requires the RIDE in coordination with the department of the attorney general to collect all public data concerning the use of force, arrest, and referrals to law enforcement or courts in different categories with a reasonable explanation.

733.title: Certification Of Teachers
733.description: Mandates RIDE to provide regulations to streamline the English Second Language (ESL) and/or English Language Learner (ELL) teaching certificate.

734.title: Offenses Pertaining To Schools [see Title 16 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act]
734.description: Prohibits the use of a school district's listserv to distribute any political advertisement, invitation, and/or propaganda.

735.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
735.title: Rights And Duties Teachers Generally - September 11 Classroom Moment Of Silence
735.description: Allows teachers in all grades to provide the opportunity for students to observe a brief moment of silence on every September 11.

738.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
738.title: Covid Recovery Plans
738.description: Directs all school districts to prepare district recovery plans, which would include strategies and targets for students, to address losses in both academic and social-emotional learning.

739.title: Regional Vocational Schools
739.description: SEE TITLE 16 CHAPTER 97 -- THE RHODE ISLAND BOARD OF EDUCATION ACT) (Amends the career and technical education program laws to provide the process by which students could access career and technical education programs outside of their home school district.

740.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
740.title: Biliteracy Seal
740.description: Allows high school students receiving state Silver/Gold Seal of Biliteracy to earn 2 to 4 semesters of college credit toward minor/major in language at public university/community college if requested within 3 yrs. after high school graduation.

742.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
742.title: The Rhode Island School For Dyslexia Act
742.description: Establishes a charter school for students with dyslexia.

743.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
743.title: Education Of Children With Dyslexia And Related Disorders
743.description: Provides that if a school district established an Orton-Gillingham certified school, the program would be available to all students statewide who qualify.

744.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
744.title: Charter Schools
744.description: Allows charter schools to engage in nontraditional approaches to learning which must be approved by the department of education.

745.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
745.title: Prescription Drug Cost Protection
745.description: Prohibits the state, ERISA or any health plans to purchase referenced drugs for a cost higher than the referenced rate.

747.title: Relating To Health And Safety
747.description: Requires medical spas to employ or contract for the services of a licensed physician, physician assistant, or registered nurse.

748.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
748.title: Professional Responsibility -- Criminal Records Review
748.description: Requires patient contact employees, personal care attendants and high-risk providers to undergo a national criminal records check and would disqualify those people if they have a criminal record for crimes of violence or other offenses listed.

749.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
749.title: Developmental Disabilities Ombudsperson Act Of 2021
749.description: Creates a developmental disabilities ombudsperson program to be administratively attached to the department of administration.

753.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
753.title: License Of Naturopathy Act
753.description: Changes the name of doctor of naturopathy to naturopathic doctor and permit them to administer IVs, perform phlebotomy, and consult, but not change, patient’s prescription medication.

757.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
757.title: Fair Employments Practices
757.description: Amends the definition of employees to include gig workers for purposes of the fair employment practices chapter.

758.title: The Rhode Island Whistle Blowers' Protection Act
758.description: Prohibits an employer from reporting an employee's immigration status for whistle blowing.

760.title: Courts
760.description: Requires the courts of Rhode Island to establish an Internet link and live-stream all proceedings, except those recognized as confidential.

761.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
761.title: County Grand Juries
761.description: Permits county and statewide grand juries to issue reports with review/acceptance by superior court with sunset date of July 1, 2026.

763.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
763.title: Procedure Generally -- Causes Of Action
763.description: Expands and creates civil causes of action for certain protected groups who experience threats or intimidation.

766.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
766.title: Rhode Island Pain-capable Unborn Child Protection Act
766.description: Creates the Rhode Island Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection Act, prohibiting the performance or induction of an abortion of an unborn child capable of feeling pain, unless necessary to prevent serious health risk to the unborn child’s mother. Eff 1/1/21

769.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
769.title: Special Commission On Reapportionment
769.description: Creates an eighteen (18) member special commission to reapportion all general assembly districts and congressional districts based on 2020 federal Census data by January 15, 2022.

770.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
770.title: Relating To Public Utilities And Carriers
770.description: Includes sworn law enforcement officers and Rhode Island state troopers in the group of persons who may obtain the name, address and telephone numbers of persons to whom nonpublished service is furnished.

772.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
772.title: Motor Vehicle Offense
772.description: Extends the "look back" period for a third and subsequent driving under the influence (DUI) and a refusal to submit to a chemical test to ten (10) years from the current five (5) years.

773.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
773.title: Operation Of Bicycles
773.description: Creates 3 classes of electric bicycles with provisions for requirements governing their regulation/use with exceptions from sections dealing with other vehicles regulated by DMV.

775.title: Uniform Foreign-country Money Judgments Recognition Act
775.description: Establishes the policies and procedures required for the recognition and enforcement of Foreign-Country Money Judgments and Registration of Canadian Judgments by the superior court.

776.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
776.title: Correctional Institutions
776.description: Repeals the provision of the general laws declaring prisoners serving a life sentence civilly dead.

777.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
777.title: Seizure Of Animals Being Cruelly Treated
777.description: Allows defendant to be served petition at arraignment for animal cruelty.

780.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
780.title: Lobbying
780.description: Prohibits lobbyists from making any political contributions to any member of the general assembly from January 1 through July 1 in any year, unless the general assembly adjourns for the year prior to July 1.

781.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
781.title: Proceedings In Family Court
781.description: Prohibits any questioning of a juvenile who is suspected of delinquent or criminal behavior, unless the parent of guardian of the juvenile is present, or unless an attorney is present or the juvenile and their parents have waived their presence.

782.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
782.title: Sexual Assaults
782.description: Provides that a school teacher or employee that engages in sexual penetration of a student over fourteen (14) and less than eighteen (18) shall be guilty of third degree sexual assault.

789.title: University Of Rhode Island
789.description: Allows URI board of trustees to make small procurements up to $50,000 for construction/$10,000 for all other purchases with annual increases in the federal CPI.

793.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
793.title: State Building Code -- Administration And Enforcement
793.description: Eliminates provisions establishing a legislative regulation committee and also repeals the requirement that codes and standards adopted by the state building code standards committee is subject to approval by the legislative regulation committee

794.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
794.title: Payment Of Statutory Fees
794.description: Allows state departments and agencies to implement electronic filing of applications for licenses, permits, registrations, certificates and functions by allowing a vendor to withhold a commission for implementing the system for electronic filing.

795.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
795.title: Audio And Video Recordings
795.description: Requires live streaming, over the Internet, of any open meeting of every municipal and state public body, including the executive departments. Video copies of the meeting are required to be published within twenty-four (24) hours.

796.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
796.title: Public Transit Authority
796.description: Enables the Rhode Island public transit authority (RIPTA) to work with the Massachusetts Bay Transit Authority (MBTA) to allow commuter rail passes to be used as dual passes for both RIPTA and MBTA.

797.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
797.title: Voter Registration Cancellation
797.description: Requires the secretary of state to promulgate regulations which identify and cancel the voter registration, of any registrant that changes their residence to outside their city or town, without notifying the proper authorities.

798.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
798.title: Lyme Disease Diagnosis And Treatment
798.description: Requires insurers insures to provide coverage for any prescription drug treatment for lyme disease.

800.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
800.title: Personal Delivery Devices
800.description: Establishes rules and regulations concerning the use and registration of personal delivery devices and mobile carrying devices.

801.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
801.title: License Of Naturopathy Act Of 2017
801.description: Amends the statute that provides for the licensing of naturopaths to reflect current practice and terminology and eliminates collaboration and consultation agreements.

804.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
804.title: Pet Insurance
804.description: Provides that pet insurance policies provide notice in bold print of coverage exclusions and provide coverage for routine and preventative care and be allowed to provide coverage for wellness visits.

806.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
806.title: Associations, And Partnerships - General Provisions
806.description: Requires publicly held corporations to be represented by women on their board of directors. Fines would be imposed for non-compliance.

807.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Warwick Neck Avenue, Inc.
807.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Warwick Neck Avenue, Inc.

808.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of New England Real Estate Marketing Services, Inc.
808.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of New England Real Estate Marketing Services, Inc.

810.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
810.title: Kratom Consumer Protection Act
810.description: Regulates the distribution of food products containing the drug kratom, a drug of concern for its stimulant and sedative effects, to consumers by the department of health.

811.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
811.title: Nonprofit Dental Service Corporations
811.description: Authorizes the insurance commissioner to review dental fees paid to participating dentists by a nonprofit dental service corporation to ensure that they are fair and reasonable.

813.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
813.title: Covid-19 Pandemic Insurance Recovery Act
813.description: Allows businesses that had an insurance policy in place for business interruption as of March 9, 2019 to recover from their insurance companies for a COVID-19 business impact.

814.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
814.title: Pharmaceutical Cost Transparency
814.description: Directs the state board of pharmacy to annually identify up to fifteen prescription drugs with increased costs and provide the list to the attorney general to obtain reasons for the cost increases.

815.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
815.title: Regulation Of Business Practices Among Motor Vehicle Manufacturers, Distributors, And Dealers
815.description: Prevents a motor vehicle dealer from leasing a new or used motor vehicle to a member of the public requiring the payment of the exact amount of any excise tax assessed on the new or used motor vehicle as reimbursement to the motor vehicle dealer.

816.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
816.title: Community Antenna Television Systems
816.description: Requires cable television companies to give their customers the option to purchase, at its fair market value, a device which decodes digital cable signals for their cable signal reception.

818.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
818.title: Pupil Transportation Drivers
818.description: Enables some Massachusetts and Connecticut based students transportation providers without Rhode Island licensed and registered vehicles to operate in Rhode Island, under limited conditions.

819.title: Green Buildings Act
819.description: Repeals the expiration provisions that major facility projects or other public improvements comply with green building standards, thereby requiring major facility projects of state agencies to be construed to LEED standards.

820.title: Coastal Hazards
820.description: Authorizes the state’s twenty-one coastal communities to adopt the coastal resources management council's (CRMC) coastal hazard application process applicable to a local overlay district.

821.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
821.title: Commercial Fisheries
821.description: Permits the dockside sale of allowable finfish, live lobsters, crabs and live whelk upon issuance of a temporary direct sale dealer license by the department of environmental management to a commercial fishing license holder.

822.title: The Permanent Air Quality Monitoring Act
822.description: Extends air quality monitoring requirements and data submission deadline by one year.

823.title: Relating To Health And Safety- High-heat Waste Facility Act Of 2021
823.description: Prohibits new high-heat waste processing facilities.

824.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
824.title: Environmental Justice Focus Areas
824.description: Establishes environmental justice focus areas/coastal zones/ establishes procedures for investigation/ remediation of contaminated sites within coastal zones by DEM with increased community participation.

825.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
825.title: Days Of Special Observance
825.description: Designates June 12 annually as Women Veterans' Day as a day of special observance in the state of Rhode Island.

827.title: Tuition For Covered Individuals Under Post-911 Bill And Montgomery Gi Bill
827.description: In state tuition continues for military service members children and/or spouse, if service member transferred.

828.title: Medical Assistance -- Perinatal Doula Services
828.description: Provides for medical assistance health care for expectant mothers and would establish medical assistance coverage and reimbursement rates for perinatal doula services. Effective 7/1/22.

829.title: Relating To Food And Drugs-the Rhode Island Cannabis Equity Act
829.description: Establishes a board and appropriates funds from the legislature to create a local cannabis equity program to allow those people who want to enter the business of selling marijuana with state funding and technical assistance to do so.

830.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
830.title: Federal Aid
830.description: Requires free lunches to be provided for all elementary and secondary students attending public schools, to the extent state and federal funds are available.

831.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
831.title: Child Care Subsidy Eligibility
831.description: Authorizes both parents to seek financial child care benefits for their children rather than restricting it to the custodial parent.

835.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
835.title: Health And Safety Of Pupils -- Trauma Informed Schools Act
835.description: Establishes the implementation of trauma-informed practices in schools throughout the state.

837.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
837.title: Wages
837.description: Increases the minimum wage by using an annual fixed amount until 1/1/25, where it reaches to $15 per hour, then raised annually thereafter by using the CPI-W. Also raises hourly minimum wage for employees receiving gratuities by using similar scale.

838.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
838.title: Joint Committee On Disaster Oversight
838.description: Creates the Joint Committee on Disaster Oversight which would consist of twelve (12) members to study the impact of the governor's declaration of a disaster emergency pursuant to § 30-15-9.

842.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
842.title: State Archives
842.description: Clearly defines permanent state records to be retained/ requires preparation of disaster preparedness plan/ allows access to superior court for injunctions/ restraining orders for violations of public records laws.

843.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
843.title: Executive Office Of Commerce
843.description: Creates a deputy secretary of commerce and housing within the executive office of commerce to oversee housing initiatives and develop a housing plan.

846.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
846.title: Food Security And Agriculture Jobs
846.description: Protects food security and creates agricultural jobs and opportunities with the goal of creating food security. Employs several mechanisms to do so, including the creation of the agriculture jobs bureau, to be located within the division of agriculture.

847.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
847.title: Powers During State Of Emergency
847.description: Grants chairman of PUC and DPUC emergency powers during governor declared emergencies for restoration of all utility services.

848.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
848.title: Insurance Rates
848.description: Prevents the consideration of an applicant's credit history in determining automobile liability insurance rates.

849.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
849.title: Non Profit Dental Service
849.description: Provides that non profit dental service corporations shall have the power to provide for the administering and/or insuring of vision and optometric programs.

850.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
850.title: General Regulatory Provisions -- Rhode Island Transparency And Privacy Protection Act
850.description: Creates the "Rhode Island data Transparency and Privacy Protection Act" to identify information collected by online service providers and commercial websites.

851.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
851.title: Freedom To Travel And Work Act
851.description: Establishes an occupational regulatory framework by authorizing the issuance of occupational licenses and government certifications by recognition for qualified worker applicants from other states.

853.title: Transfer Of Vehicles
853.description: Provides that a lessee of a motor vehicle who purchases the vehicle within one year of the lease inception or any renewal thereof shall be exempt from certain registration transfer provisions.

854.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
854.title: Inspection Of Motor Vehicles
854.description: Exempt vehicles purchased at the end of their lease term by the current lessee that have a valid certificate of inspection affixed to the windshield from the requirement that dealers of used vehicles conduct a new inspection.

855.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
855.title: Rhode Island Salvage Law
855.description: Eliminates the notarization requirement for various certificates filed by insurance companies.

856.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
856.title: Certificates Of Title And Security Interests
856.description: Authorizes the Exeter town sergeant or designees to conduct division of motor vehicles vehicle identifying number and odometer inspections.

857.title: Appliance And Equipment Energy And Water Efficiency Standards Act Of 2021
857.description: Establishes efficiency standards for selected residential and commercial products.

858.title: The Ocean State Climate Adaptation Fund
858.description: Establishes the Ocean State Climate Adaptation and Resilience Fund.

859.title: Birds
859.description: Removes the prohibition of taking, killing or destroying wild birds by crossbow.

865.title: Courts -- Court Administration
865.description: Invests the chief justice of the supreme court with the explicit authority to address issues affecting the conduct of judicial business and order whatever response(s) he or she deems necessary.

866.title: Law Practice
866.description: Provide that the rules of the unauthorized practice of law committee would be approved and promulgated by the supreme court.

869.title: Adjudication Of Traffic Offenses
869.description: Removes the $25.00 limit on tuition for a motorist to attend a driver education course, and would allow a judge or magistrate to delay the imposition of a suspension or revocation of a driver's license or registration for a period up to 30 days.

870.title: Motor Vehicle Reparations Act
870.description: Provides that financial security is required for any motor vehicle registered or required to be registered in the state of Rhode Island.

872.title: Automated Traffic Speed Enforcement System
872.description: Authorizes the use of automated traffic-speed camera-enforcement systems on all state and local roads within the state, not just in school zones

873.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
873.title: Relating To Criminal Procedure-identification And Apprehension Of Criminals
873.description: Repeals requirement of one hundred dollar fee for expungements and requires court administrator advise general treasurer and/or the registry of the court that any bail money on deposit be returned to the defendant or surety.

875.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
875.title: Rhode Island Title Insurers Act
875.description: Provides that only RI attorneys can act as title insurance agents and determine insurability and marketability. Limits discount title insurance premiums and restricts sharing premiums.

877.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
877.title: Rhode Island Public Transit Authority
877.description: Limits damages to one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) in any tort action against the Rhode Island public transit authority, except in cases where the general assembly, by a special act, authorizes a tort action in excess of that amount.

878.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
878.title: Liens Against Causes Of Action
878.description: Prohibits a hospital from claiming a lien on any damages recovered by a Medicaid patient as a result of an accident not covered by workers' compensation.

879.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
879.title: Mandatory Vaccination Agreement Prohibited
879.description: Prohibits discrimination against individuals who refuse to be vaccinated.

881.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
881.title: Burglary And Breaking And Entering
881.description: Adds a rebuttable defense if any person shall die or sustain a personal injury while committing robbery of the owner, lessor, or occupant of a motor vehicle and that the owner or occupant of the vehicle acted in self defense.

883.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
883.title: Rishod K. Gore Justice In Policing Act Of 2021
883.description: Provides police reform by requiring body cameras and makes certain methods of restraint a felony such as chokeholds and using the foot as a weapon.

885.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
885.title: Relating Criminal Procedure -- Sentence And Execution
885.description: Changes the criteria for distinguishing between felonies, misdemeanors and petty misdemeanors. It also changes the interpretation of the phrase "one year" wherever it appears in the general or public laws, to be three hundred sixty-four (364) days.

887.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
887.title: Public Records Administration
887.description: Updates public records administration act, modifies records control schedule, designates records officer, establishes procedures for retention of records. Provides administrator submit yearly reports, establishes public reporting compliance.

888.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
888.title: Write-in Votes
888.description: Requires all write in candidates to file prior to election a declaration of intent to run for office with the secretary of state. Finally it would require the board of elections to report all votes received by declared write in candidates.

891.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
891.title: Relating To Elections
891.description: Makes very comprehensive changes to the election laws concerning voter registration, voter rights, mail ballots and early day voting.

895.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
895.title: Relating To Election S-- Mail Ballots
895.description: Prohibits the secretary of state from mass mailing mail ballots and requires that the elector request a mail ballot.

897.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
897.title: Relating To The General Assembly Redistricting Act
897.description: Creates a redistricting commission to act every 10 years to adopt a redistricts plan for all general assembly and congressional districts. It also provides for a possible appeal of the plan to the state supreme court.

898.title: Relief Of Injured And Deceased Firefighters And Police Officers
898.description: Extends IOD benefits to police officers/firefighters suffering from post-traumatic stress injuries/provides municipal police/firefighters retiring due to PTSI accidental disability retirement allowance.

899.title: Healthy And Safe Families And Workplace Act
899.description: Amends the definition of paid sick leave time and paid sick and safe leave time and allow 40 hours of accrual for construction industry employees.

900.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
900.title: Tipped Minimum Wage
900.description: Gradually increases the tipped minimum wage from the current $3.89 to $14.95 commencing January 1, 2026 and on January 1, 2027 the tipped minimum wage shall be no less than the minimum wage established by the minimum wage law.

901.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
901.title: Building Service Work
901.description: Requires that janitors and security guards employed, pursuant to state contracts worth more than one thousand dollars ($1,000) of janitorial or security services, be paid a standard compensation rate.

902.title: Office Of State Medical Examiners
902.description: Removes the sunset provision on the requirement that the office of state medical examiners be responsible for a multidisciplinary team review of drug related overdose deaths.

905.title: Hospital Workplace Violence Protection Act
905.description: Establishes procedures for employees to file complaints with a hospital or the director of department of health, for assaultive behavior or violation of law occurring on hospital grounds/requires hospitals to institute safety training for employees.

907.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
907.title: Creating A Special Legislative Commission To Study Rhode Island's Payment And Reimbursement For Hospital-acquired Conditions
907.description: HAC) AND HEALTHCARE-ASSOCIATED INFECTIONS (HAI) AND PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS TO ESTABLISH/CLARIFY THE STATE'S POLICY AND PROCEDURES (Creates a 9 member commission to study Rhode Island's payment and reimbursement for (HAC) and (HAI) and provide recommendations for the state's policy and procedures, and would report back by January 5, 2022 and expire on March 5, 2022.

909.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
909.title: Council On Elementary And Secondary Education
909.description: Requires the council on elementary and secondary education to adopt standards which take into consideration the time and cost of transporting students across municipal boundaries and promotes maximum efficiency in other programs.

911.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
911.title: State Funds
911.description: Adds the Judiciary's Indirect Cost Recovery/Supreme Court, Victims' Rights Information, RI Supreme Court Disciplinary Counsel and Small Claims Mediation accounts to the list of restricted receipt accounts which are not subject to indirect cost recovery.

912.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
912.title: Courts - District Court
912.description: Creates within the district court a dedicated calendar offering treatment and sentencing alternatives to eligible defendants deemed to suffer from serious and persistent mental illness to be known as the "Mental Health Treatment Calendar".

913.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
913.title: Divestment Of State Pension Funds From Military Contractors
913.description: Requires the state investment commission to identify pension fund investments in military weapon manufacturers whether held directly and indirectly with certain exceptions.

914.title: Graduate Medical Education
914.description: Allows the executive office of health and human services to use appropriated funds to support graduate medical education programs and research. At the same time implementing the appropriate payment mechanism in order to make the payments annually.

918.title: The Telemedicine Coverage Act
918.description: Amends the provisions of the telemedicine coverage act and provide coverage for telemedicine under Rhode Island Medicaid.

919.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
919.title: Fiscal Notes
919.description: Clarifies existing statutory scheme as it relates to fiscal notes regarding criminal justice and related legislation. Requires the fiscal notes speak to issues of whether the legislation enhances public safety and contains sensible fiscal policy.

920.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
920.title: Tax Credits For Contributions To Scholarship Organizations
920.description: Increases the aggregate amount of tax credits for contributions to scholarship organizations to $5,000,000 for 2022.

923.title: Relating To A Tax Agreement Between The City Of East Providence And Exxonmobil Oil Corporation
923.description: Provides for a tax treaty between the city of East Providence and ExxonMobil Oil Corporation subject to the ratification of the East Providence city council.

924.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
924.title: Subdivision Of Land

1175.description: Authorizes the department of transportation to impose a weight restriction or close any state, local or privately-owned bridge, in the interest of public safety.

1176.title: Solar Panels
1176.description: Establish group for placement of solar panels on inter-state highways, would use America Rescue Plan Act of 2021 for funding.

1177.title: Redevelopment Agencies
1177.description: Expands the definition of a redevelopment area to include all population census tracts in the state that have been or are designated as opportunity zones.

1178.title: Statewide Body-worn Camera Program
1178.description: Creates a statewide body-worn camera program for police departments in the state.

1179.title: Amending Establishing The Smithfield Land Trust
1179.description: Amends the public law establishing the Smithfield Land Trust by requiring a four-fifths (4/5) affirmative vote of the town council to dispose of land that no longer meets the needs of the trust.

1180.title: Personal Watercraft Safety Act
1180.description: Authorizes the town of West Greenwich to provide, by ordinance, regulations controlling the use of personal watercraft on any or all fresh or inland waters of the town.

1182.title: Theft, Embezzlement, False Pretenses And Misappropriations
1182.description: Requires that penalties or restitution payments for larceny of a campaign account or campaign expenditure reporting violations be deposited into the Rhode Island crime victim compensation program fund and not into the candidate's campaign account.

1184.title: Protection And Supervision Of Criminal Witnesses
1184.description: Amend the title of Chapter 12-30 of the General Laws to be "The Jennifer Rivera Witness Protection Act".

1185.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of East Passage Estates Lot Owners’ Association
1185.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of East Passage Estates Lot Owners’ Association

1186.last_action: Introduced, referred to House State Government & Elections
1186.title: Relating To State Affairs And Government – Historian Laureate Of Rhode Island
1186.description: Reduces the appoint the historian laureate from a five (5) year term to a two (2) year term, and requires the historian laureate to develop and implement programs about pertinent aspects of Rhode Island history.

1190.last_action: Introduced, referred to House State Government & Elections
1190.title: Primary Elections
1190.description: Changes the process of nominating candidates for the general election, by replacing the political party primary with a primary general election.

1191.title: Little Cigar Tax
1191.description: Requires that the tax imposed on little cigars be imposed in the same manner as the tax imposed on cigarettes, that 25% of such tax revenue would be applied to smoking cessation programs, and requires that little cigars be sold in packs of 20 or more.

1193.title: Green New Deal Act Of 2021
1193.description: Establishes a climate action plan to eliminate the state's dependence on fossil fuel energy generation of electricity and replace the required generation of electricity from clean energy resources by calendar year 2036.

1196.title: Qualified Data Centers Location Incentive
1196.description: Establishes incentives for property sales and use tax exemptions for qualified data centers located in Rhode Island upon a minimum qualified investment of $50,000,000 in a designated enterprise zone and $200,000,000 in a non-enterprise zone.

1201.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Veterans Affairs
1201.title: Veterans' Affairs
1201.description: Creates a registry of veterans exposed to airborne hazards open burn pits while serving in southwest Asia theaters of operations after August 2, 1990 and September 11, 2011.

1202.last_action: Introduced, referred to House State Government & Elections
1202.title: Race, Ethnicity And Gender Impact Statement Act
1202.description: Requires the general assembly to provide race, ethnicity and gender impact statements as to all legislation, addressing the disproportionate impact of the legislation on people of color and gender.

1203.description: Relating To Making Revised Appropriations In Support Of Fiscal Year 2022
